intro: Brachystelma cummingii, commonly known as the Cape flower, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. This succulent plant is characterized by its small, fleshy leaves and vibrant, star-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of red, yellow, and orange. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and mountainous regions. Brachystelma cummingii is adapted to arid conditions, making it a resilient and drought-tolerant species.
